Recent topics I have learned about

Here I learned more about Git and the whole process of static site generation - such as downloading a repo, making a new branch, changing the code, committing those changes, then merging the branches together and pushing to origin. I then explored how to start adding Bootstrap elements to my 11ty site.

Learning about 11ty was interesting because I hadn't come across it before in my time studying web design. It's a great way of setting up new, simple websites quickly, without too much work. I also learned about templates and folder structure which is good to know.

Here I was introduced to Git and Github Desktop. Prior to the session, I had little knowledge of Git, so I enjoyed learning about how it works and what can be done with it. I also enjoyed learning how Github Desktop works with VS Code, in which you can push changes directly from your local machine to an online repository.
